key_title: Key to the species of Microseris

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Cypselas usually less than 7 mm long; pappus scales to c. 20, noticeably widened at base; ligules usually more than 15 mm long; roots cylindrical or napiform, branched or not; lowland to alpine plants, rarely on basaltic soils

Cypselas mostly 7–10 mm long; pappus scales 30–66, hardly widened at base; ligules to c. 15 mm long; roots several, cylindrical or long-tapered, usually branched shortly below leaves; mostly from basalt plains
Pappus scales 10–20, c. 0.3–0.5 mm wide at base; fleshy roots several, cylindrical to long-tapered, branching just below ground-level; alpine and subalpine

Pappus scales usually c. 10, 0.5–1.3 mm wide at base; fleshy root usually expanding to a solitary, napiform to narrow-ellipsoid or narrow-ovoid, annually replaced tuber (rarely stocky, few-branched and apparently perennial); widespread in lowland areas
